META.prose: The three main types of heat-related illness are heat cramps, heat exhaustion and heat stroke.

TIMELINE.title: Heat Cramps
TIMELINE.body: Symptoms include painful muscle cramps and spasms, particularly in the legs, as well as moist skin.

TIMELINE.title: Heat Exhaustion
TIMELINE.body: Usually begins when the body's tempurature reaches 100.4 degrees Fahrenheit. Symptoms include heat cramps as well as nausea, vomiting, diarreah, headache, fatigue, weakness and anxiety

TIMELINE.title: Heat Stroke
TIMELINE.body: Usually begins when the body's temperature reaches 104 degrees Fahrenheit. Symptoms include those of heat cramps and heat exhaustion, as well as warm skin, rapid heart rate, loss of appetite, confusion, agitation, lethargy, stupor, seizures, coma and possibly death
